page.title: 19W'HEATH EMPLOYMENT
page.content:
Although most people are{employed in {Ledbury}and some{commute}even further, there is some{local work}on the farms. Withers fruit farm takes on{40 pickers in the season and there is a small private{saw mill}on one farm, the farmer selling logs to the village. Arknell Farm, however, has sold its land and is just a private house.
The{old village school}was bought in 1955. The school house was converted into a more luxurious home and the school was used to store items for an{antique business.}In 1984 the entirely family business progressed to {wood-stripping;}old furniture being {repaired and renovated. Near the village at Loxter, there is an{underground reservoir,}operated by the Welsh Water Authority.
